name: 黃瀅瑛
objective: This course focus on the understanding of consumer behavior through consumers' decision-making processes as well as consumers' attitudes towards certain products. How and why do consumers make their consumption choices, how do they think and act during the processes, and do they feel satisfied or dissatisfied with their decisions? Various underlying concepts and topics will be discussed (e.g. perception and cognition, human behavior, user experience, ergonomics, human-centered design, policy and social norms, product development, etc.)
schedule:
Week 01: Course introduction and announcement
Week 02-03: Introduction to consumer behavior
Week 04-05: Consumer decision process
Week 06-07: Pre-purchase process
Week 08-09: Purchase process
Week 10: TBD (midterm assignment)
Week 11: Post-purchase process
Week 12-13: Individual differences
Week 14-15: Influencing consumer behavior
Week 16-17: Final project presentation
Week 18: TBD (final exam week)
scorePolicy:
In-class assignment(s) & participation: 25%
Individual report or mid-term exam: 35%
Final project: 40%
materials: Blackwell, R. D., Miniard, P. W., and Engel, J. F. (2006). Consumer Behavior (10th ed.). Mason: Thomson.
